column4: when i try to stream something from a site the file is  400mb and i am trying to watch it but i get this error-> The xine engine failed to start. No input plugin was found. Maybe the file does not exist or cannot be accessed, or there is an error in the URL.
what does this mean -> The xine engine failed to start. No input plugin was found. Maybe the file does not exist or cannot be accessed, or there is an error in the URL. please somebody
you probly dont have the codec to play whatever youre trying to play. or the site sucks and theres an error in the URL
or Maybe the file does not exist or  cannot be accessed
i have no idea what kind of file it is...you might need wmv codecs, you might need all kinds of stuff
either way, get vlc, its the best video player in the entire world

:/ but how can i start with vlc :)when i click on this link -> http://vzj43867:cejekea8@members.videosz.com/movie.php?lg=us&player=1&dvd_id=791&scene_type=movie&id_place=2&file=http%3A%2F%2Fmembers.videosz.com%2F6%2F791%2F6-black-sticks-1-white-trick-3-scene2.avi  it will only bring up xine error
you probly have to assiciate .avi's with vlc in your browser
but how can i let this vlc rise when this xine stuff runs automatic when i click on the link :( is there a way to change this ?
try playing a real movie file and not some wack pr0n which introduces like 10 more variables into the situation
so what? youre trying to troubleshoot right? thats how you do it
vlc
there is no problem playing .movies.
probably...
find a new site
jesus dude...
i chooce another site and the same shitt happins agein

dude, i dont even know what kind of browser youre using. from the extremely poor way youve been trying to explain this problem, i can only *guess* that its a file association problem. read your browser's docs or google around on how to change that
ok thx man
so it was a file association problem?
i didnt mean to get on your case like that, but being able to explain your problem *is* half the problem
